newsitem.title: CANADA: Cognos slips as U.S. investors sell.
newsitem.headline: Cognos slips as U.S. investors sell.

text.p: Shares in Cognos Inc dipped on Tuesday after U.S. investors returned from the President's Day holiday and decided the software company was overpriced.
"It's fundamentally overvalued," said Duncan Stewart, portfolio manager at Tera Capital.

Investors instead are turning their attention to France-based competitor Business Objects SA, which also makes business intelligence software for database management but provides cheaper shares, Stewart said.
Cognos shares lost 1-3/8 to reach 22-3/4 on nearly 1.4 million shares on Nasdaq.
Business Objects traded flat at 12-1/2 on Nasdaq.
In Toronto, Cognos dropped 3.00 to 31.00 in light dealings.
Cognos representative Roberta Carlton said the Ottawa-based company knew of "no reason for our stock meandering."
